com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.argument

Class CharIterableArgs

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.argument.CharIterableArgs

  • public class CharIterableArgs
extends Object
    Static methods to check Iterable<Character> arguments.

    See ObjectArgs for an overview.

    Author:
    Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)

    • Method Detail

      • checkValueInsideRange

        @FullyTested
public static <TIterable extends Iterable<Character>> TIterable checkValueInsideRange(TIterable ref,
                                                                                  char minValue,
                                                                                  char maxValue,
                                                                                  String argName)
        Tests if all values in an Iterable are within specified range.

        Example: All values must be >= 3 and <= 7:
        checkValueInsideRange(numbersList, 3, 7, "numbersList");

        Parameters:
        ref - iterable of values to test. May be empty
        minValue - minimum value (inclusive) for inclusive range of each value in array to test
        maxValue - maximum value (inclusive) for inclusive range of each value in array to test
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "valueList"
        Returns:
        the validated iterable
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref (or any element) is null
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • if minValue > maxValue
        • if any value of ref is outside allowed range
        See Also:
        checkValueOutsideRange(Iterable, char, char, String), CharArrayArgs.checkValueInsideRange(char[], char, char, String), CharArrayArgs.checkValueInsideRange(Character[], char, char, String)

      • checkValueOutsideRange

        @FullyTested
public static <TIterable extends Iterable<Character>> TIterable checkValueOutsideRange(TIterable ref,
                                                                                   char minValue,
                                                                                   char maxValue,
                                                                                   String argName)
        Tests if all values in an Iterable are not within specified range.

        Example: All values must be <= 3 and >= 7:
        checkValueInsideRange(numbersList, 4, 6, "numbersList");

        Parameters:
        ref - iterable of values to test. May be empty
        minValue - minimum value (inclusive) for inclusive range of each value in array to test
        maxValue - maximum value (inclusive) for inclusive range of each value in array to test
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "valueList"
        Returns:
        the validated iterable
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref (or any element) is null
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • if minValue > maxValue
        • if any value of ref is inside not-allowed range
        See Also:
        checkValueInsideRange(Iterable, char, char, String), CharArrayArgs.checkValueOutsideRange(char[], char, char, String), CharArrayArgs.checkValueOutsideRange(Character[], char, char, String)

      • checkMinValue

        @FullyTested
public static <TIterable extends Iterable<Character>> TIterable checkMinValue(TIterable ref,
                                                                          char minValue,
                                                                          String argName)
        Tests if all values in an Iterable have a minimum value.
        Parameters:
        ref - iterable of values to test. May be empty
        minValue - minimum value (inclusive)
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "valueList"
        Returns:
        the validated iterable
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref (or any element) is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if any value of ref is less than minValue
        See Also:
        checkMaxValue(Iterable, char, String), CharArrayArgs.checkMinValue(char[], char, String), CharArrayArgs.checkMinValue(Character[], char, String)

        Parameters:

        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "valueList"

        @FullyTested
public static <TIterable extends Iterable<Character>> TIterable checkExactValue(TIterable ref,
                                                                            char exactValue,
                                                                            String argName)
        Tests if all values in an Iterable have an exact value.
        Parameters:
        ref - iterable of values to test. May be empty
        exactValue - expected value
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "valueList"
        Returns:
        the validated iterable
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref (or any element) is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if any value of ref is exactValue
        See Also:
